{{also|猪头三牲}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=猪头三牲|type=211}}

===Etymology===
This idiom arose from {{zh-l|豬頭|pig head}}.

In Wu it is reinterpreted as a ''[[歇後語|xiehouyu]]'': {{lang|zh|[[豬頭三]]──牲}}, i.e. "A {{lang|zh|豬頭三}} is an animal/a beast/an idiot".

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=zhūtóusānshēng
|c=zyu1 tau4 saam1 sang1
|cat=id
}}

===Idiom===
{{zh-idiom}}

# Referring to [[animals]] (bull, sheep and pig) used in sacrifice, or sacrificial [[offering]] in general.
